column1: Table 12. Percent of arrest-related deaths, by alleged crimes committed by decedent and manner of death, as reported by responding agencies, June-August 2015
Report title: Arrest-Related Deaths Program: Pilot Study of Redesigned Survey Methodology  NCJ 252675
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Arrest-Related Deaths Program-Redesign Study, 2015
Author: Connor Brooks and Kevin M. Scott, Ph.D., BJS Statisticians
Table 12. Percent of arrest-related deaths, by alleged crimes committed by decedent and manner of death, as reported by responding agencies, June-August 2015
During events up to death any crime
Deceased committed or allegedly committed any crime
Deceased did not commit or allegedly commit any crimes
Note: Details may not sum to totals due to rounding. Manner of death was missing for 10 arrest-related deaths. CJ-11A forms were missing for 121 of the 424 arrest-related deaths.
a/Homicide is the willful killing of one person by another and includes justifiable homicide by a law enforcement officer.
b/Includes other violent offenses, kidnapping, and carjacking.
c/Includes burglary, larceny, or other property offenses.
d/Includes traffic violation, resisting arrest, or other public-order offenses.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, Arrest-Related Deaths Program-Redesign Study, 2015.
